intro: Hieracium cophanense, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium cophanense is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
